captions.text:
- STILL SCORELESS WITH ONLY
A FEW MINUTES REMAINING.

CLEARLY A FLOP.
NO CONTACT MADE.

IT ALL COMES DOWN TO THIS
AS THE POWER FALCONS PREPARE

THIS IS THE LAST CHANCE
TO WIN THE GAME.

THESE ARE THE DYING SECONDS
OF THE MATCH.

AND WHAT IS THIS?
CAN YOU BELIEVE IT?

FEDERNOIR IS BACK
ON THE PITCH.

HE'S ALIVE AND TAKING
THE FREE KICK.

HE SHOOTS. HE SCORES.
OH, MY!

SO MANY RULES CLEARLY BROKEN
LEADING UP TO THAT GOAL,

comments.author: SeeGoat

comments.text:
Oh God as a USSF soccer referee, I know this is just a comedy sketch but 
all of these errors are painful to watch. I mean no badge on the referee 
and the countless procedural errors I can deal with, but him coming back on 
like that could never happen. A player taken off the pitch can only return 
if beckoned back by the referee after being checked over by the senior 
assistant referee or 4th official, and only at the next opportunity for a 
substitution. Then he took a free kick before the referee whistled for it, 
and touched it again afterwards which is also not allowed. That's now three 
reasons this goal never should have occurred. I mean I can take a lot of 
rules errors but this is terrible. I love K&P but they need to stay out of 
sports.﻿

comments.text:
Lol, I hate it when people flop. It's okay if you go down if it was 
physical contact and no touch on the ball, but when they exaggerate their 
injuries to get someone unnecessarily carded, that's when it bothers me 
because for me, it's taking too much advantage. I know you're supposed to 
do what ever benefits the team, but I think that's the crossing point for 
me.﻿
comments.author: Léön Kroß

comments.text:
Here's how to stop flopping in soccer (or football as 95% of the  world 
calls it):  If a player goes down for any reason, he has 30 seconds to get 
to his feet.  If he doesn't, he must leave the field for a minimum of 10 
minutes.  If his team has to play shorthanded for that time, so be it.﻿

comments.author: Christopher Nixon

comments.text:
Law 13: For both direct and indirect free kicks, the ball must be 
stationary when the kick is taken and the kicker must not touch the ball 
again until it has touched another player.

Also, injured player who has left the field can't re-enter the field until 
play has restarted, and with the referee's permission. ﻿
